name: Books of Social Consciousness Multiple Choice Quiz | Specific Subjects & Themes | 5 Questions

questions.text: Mark Mathabane wrote this best-seller about growing up under South African apartheid.
questions.explanation:
Kaffir Boy.

	Apartheid, ended only in 1994, was a strict system of racial segregation. Mathabane's book is moving and powerful.

questions.text: Citing the use of racial epithets, several school districts have banned what Mark Twain novel condemning American slavery?
options: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court
questions.explanation:
Huckleberry Finn.

	Nat Hentoff wrote a very good novel, 'The Day They Came to Arrest the Book', about the censorship struggle over 'Huckleberry Finn'.

questions.text: What 1962 book by Rachel Carson awakened the environmentalist movement by criticizing the use of DDT?
questions.explanation:
Silent Spring.

	'For the first time in the history of the world,' Carson wrote, 'every human being is now subjected to contact with dangerous chemicals from the moment of conception until death.' DDT, a pesticide, was banned soon after the appearance of her book.

questions.text: In 1999, scandal erupted over what book about Guatemalan human rights abuses, written by a woman who won the Nobel Peace Prize for it?
questions.explanation:
I, Rigoberta Menchu.

	Menchu was accused of fabricating parts of her moving {story;} for example, a younger brother whom she said starved to death in the fields is actually alive and well with a wife and children. Menchu responded to the accusations by saying that her book was not her story per se, but the story of the Guatemalan people as a whole.

questions.text: Yevgeny Zamyatin wrote what first dystopian novel, criticizing the Soviet government and paving the way for George Orwell's '1984' and Aldous Huxley's 'Brave New World'?
questions.explanation:
We.

	The citizens (numbered, not named) in 'We' live in a city enclosed by a wall of glass. Chaos erupts when the protagonist, a mathematician, begins to think of himself as an individual.
